The king said.
It's protected by the power of merit.
How dare you take it?
The mother said.
Let's stop.
It will surely be obtained later.
Suddenly, one day.
He sent an envoy to the marketplace.
He bought a fish and returned.
He cut his belly and obtained a ring.
The crowd was all startled.
The king then praised him, saying.
Good, my mother!
It's called certainty.
It's like the lion's roar.
Later, Ānanda returned to the king's place.
The king became even more convinced.
It's called the power of merit.
It's really like this.
I will ultimately delight in cultivating meritorious actions.

translation: Fogai zhengxing zhouji jing, vol. 7
